In 2004, Google formed a non-profit philanthropic wing, [[Google.org]], with a start-up fund of US$1 billion.<ref name="philanthropy">"[http://www.google.org/about.html About the Foundation]." One of its first projects is to develop a viable [[plug-in hybrid]] [[electric vehicle]] that can attain 100 [[fuel economy in automobiles|mpg]]. ''[[The New York Times]].'' [[September 14]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[October 11]], [[2007]].</ref>

==Features and Functionality==
  +
<!--This section might be neeeded to be seperated into a new and seperate article about the Google Search Engine-->
  +
<!--A link to the new article should be added to see also if or when this section is removed-->
  +
<!--Do not add too [[google platform]] as it is hardware related-->
  +
[[Image:Feature.png|right|picture of the interface for one of the Google search engines most useful features a definition link for most searches including dictionary words]]
  +
The Google search engine has many Intuitive Features making it more functional, that could have played a small role in making it as popular as it is today. Google is along with Wikipedia one of the Top Ten most visited websites today{{cn}} (2008). Some of the features include a definition link for most searches including dictionary words, a list of how many results you got on your search, links to other searches like for instance you mispelled something it gives you a link to the search results for if you had typed in the correct search, and many more. Whether its' functionality or speed or whatever it was brought it to the status it it is today(2008).
